docs.lead_paragraph: IN ONE of the largest bookshops in town, when the tide of holiday buying was just beginning, there was a girl almost grown, with a great rope of straw-colored hair down her back. She stood by the fiction counter, and just behind her was her mother. The following conversation was overheard:

headline.main: HOLIDAY BOOKS.; SOME ASPECTS OF THE BOOK TRADE IN THIS SEASON -- A LIST OF ONE HUNDRED FAVORED BOOKS.
